You will be responsible for analyzing large datasets, building robust data pipelines, and developing insights to support our performance marketing and site strategies.Key Responsibilities:Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in both performance marketing and ecommerce metrics.Develop and maintain complex data models and visualizations to support a comprehensive understanding of marketing campaign performance and customer behavior.Provide actionable insights to drive marketing strategy, optimize campaign performance, and improve customer acquisition and retention.Collaborate with marketing & site teams to understand their data needs, own and prioritize the roadmap, and deliver tailored insights and recommendations.Leverage Looker (or another BI tool) to create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide a holistic view of performance marketing and ecommerce metrics.We're looking for someone with:2+ years in a Data & Insights role.Prior experience with analyzing performance marketing and site metrics.Advanced proficiency in SQL and Looker. Python or R is a plus.The ability to deliver consistent insights from ambiguous data, present findings in a digestible format, and influence decision-making.Strong project management skills and ability to lead projects independently.Above and beyond collaboration skills and a track record of being a great teammate.A growth mindset, and a love for diving in and exploring data to satisfy their own curiosities.The constant desire to build dynamic, scalable, and automable tasks / pipelines.A bit about us...At Grüns, we believe that foundational nutrition should be simple and convenient for everyone. We're dedicated to bringing comprehensive and real nutrition to you through our gummies, formulated from 60 nutrient-dense and whole-food ingredients. Simply enjoy a grab-and-go snack pack of gummies daily whenever fits best in your schedule and wherever life takes you.Like you, we were disappointed. There's an infinite number of "nutrition" companies, all focused on what's best for them — not what's best for you. Hundreds of products to sell you on, low-quality ingredients, and small nutrient doses. We've seen it all.So we decided it was time to fix it. No more choking on and popping pills like a pharmacy. No more clean-up and disgust from gross powders. And no more cobbling together handfuls to dozens of supplements. Grüns is comprehensive nutrition, made convenient and delicious.Our culture:Autonomy: Only the best work at Grüns. We're all confident, independent leaders. We are proactive. We find opportunities for improvement. Don't ask; just do. When our actions impact other areas of the organization, we communicate with those functional leaders to ensure connectivity.Growth: We love to take on new challenges, learn new things, and express interest in new functions. "I've never done this before" is not an excuse; it's an opportunity.Community: We care deeply about each other. We're good humans and provide support wherever we can. We care, not just professionally but personally as well.Compensation & Perks!For every role, we aim to have highly competitive compensation -- and equity, as our growth should lead to your growth.We have a fully remote, high-trust work environment - but also come together on a quarterly basis for amazing off-sites where we can connect IRL.Everyone at Grüns works hard, but we believe in wellness and balance too. We have super strong benefits coverage -- for you and your family. We have unlimited PTO. And everyone who joins gets a free Grüns subscription, a $150/month wellness bonus, and an Oura ring and membership to track their health.

job_title: Power BI Data Analyst with Fortune 500 Bank
requirements: Akkodis is seeking an Power App Data Analyst for a contract position with our Fortune 500 banking client.Hybrid: Minneapolis, MNRate: Up to $54.23/hr W2Overview:The Data Analyst is a skilled and experienced professional responsible for providing credentialed data expertise and technical support associated with data aggregation, analysis, insight generation, reporting, and subsequent automation. In doing so, this key member will assist in the ownership of various data related processes and assist in the drive to empower key business partners and interested stakeholders. Furthermore, this member will collaborate with the team manager to identify team-based strategic goals and suggest solutions for moderate-to-complex data related challenges. Essential Functions:The core tasks, duties, and responsibilities that primarily constitute the data analyst’s role include, but are not limited to:Demonstrate up-to-date fluency in data and software-based techniques, which can then be applied to the design, development, and execution of strategic processes/projects capable of improving operational efficiencies and mitigating risk.Demonstrate technical fluency associated with a wide range of software—such as Power BI, PowerApps, and Tableau—which can then be utilized to provide end-users with data-based tools, solutions, and/or visualizations.Demonstrate knowledge and experience of Agile project methodology, including ability to enter data and report from JIRADemonstrate a focus on continued innovation through the ongoing analysis of business and system-related processes in order to ensure that data is reliable and valid, and processes are operationally efficient.Responsible for adhering to the principles of data quality management, including metadata, lineage, and process/change documentation.Provide ongoing support to applicable peers through continued collaboration, translation of business needs, and development and/or maintenance of data engineering/analytical processes.Provide project-based support by helping to organize and drive complex initiatives.Required Qualifications:Undergraduate degree in a quantitative field (i.e., analytics, computer or data science, or liberal arts degree with data focus) and/or 3-5 years of related experience.Must have PowerApps, PowerBI and Visio experience.2-3 years of hands-on experience and/or degree in appropriate field with data organization experience (can be liberal arts)Must be able to successfully work independently and with a team; this role will work with a team of 6 but is a part of a larger team of 200+ and will Interact with immediate team and larger TRO team, all internal customers, via Teams calls, face-to-face meetings and emails Nice to Have Qualifications:Master’s degree in a quantitative field (analytics, computer science, or data science) and 1-3 years of related experience.Time management skills, with focus on detail orientation and an ability to independently manage a dynamic workload.Demonstrated ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with end-users and management. ***Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/DisabledBenefit offerings include medical, dental, vision, term life insurance, short-term disability insurance, additional voluntary benefits, commuter benefits and 401K plan. Available paid leave may include Paid Sick Leave, where required by law; any other paid leave required by Federal, State or local law; and Holiday pay upon meeting eligibility criteria. Job Summary:MISION:Recopilar y procesar datos relevantes de venta y audiencias obtenidos de las diversas plataformas digitales y/o herramientas que utiliza la empresa, con el objetivo de transformarlos en información que ayude en la toma de decisiones y generación de estrategiasPRINCIPALES ACTIVIDADES A REALIZAR:Extraer insights relevantes para generar accionables al área que lo solicite usando herramientas de análisis y visualización de datos como Excel, y Tableau.Elaborar reportes que interpreten de manera avanzada el porqué de los comportamientos y tendencias de los datos en la industria.Apoyar en la elaboración de estrategias para medir la rentabilidad de los productos y servicios que ofrece Ticketmaster analizando las métricas por medio de herramientas como Tableau y BigQuery.Apoyar en el desarrollo de segmentación de audiencias que funcionen en campañas para el área de Marketing.REQUISITOS:Excel AvanzadoManejo de visualizadores de información (Tableou, Porwer BI o Tableau)Experiencia mínima de lenguajes de programación como Python o Java indispensable.Deseable conocimiento de plataformas como Databricks o BigQueryInglés conversacional intermedio - avanzado.¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?Contratación directa.Prestaciones de ley y superiores, afiliación a nuestros diversos programas internos.Estacionamiento gratuito.Jornada completa.Lugar de trabajo: Iztacalco - Metro cerca de Velódromo.Ambiente de trabajo colaborativo.LA VIDA EN TICKETMASTERNuestra visión en Ticketmaster es conectar a personas de todo el mundo con los eventos en directo que más les gustan. Como el mayor mercado de entradas del mundo y el principal proveedor global de herramientas y servicios empresariales para el negocio del entretenimiento en vivo, estamos en una posición única para cumplir con éxito esa visión.Si te apasiona el entretenimiento en vivo como a nosotros, y quieres trabajar en una empresa dedicada a ayudar a millones de fans a vivirlo, queremos saber de ti.Nuestro trabajo se guía por nuestros valores:Confiabilidad - Entendemos que los aficionados y los clientes confían en nosotros para potenciar sus experiencias en eventos en directo, y nosotros confiamos los unos en los otros para hacerlo posible.Trabajo en equipo - Creemos que los logros individuales palidecen en comparación con el nivel de éxito que puede alcanzar un equipo.Integridad: Estamos comprometidos con las normas morales y éticas más estrictas en nombre de los innumerables socios y partes interesadas a los que representamos.Pertenencia: Nos comprometemos a crear una cultura en la que todas las personas puedan ser auténticas, tener la misma voz y las mismas oportunidades de prosperar.

At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that’s not all. Whether we’re leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada.Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you.Join our dynamic and innovative Fraud Analytics team, where we are committed to safeguarding millions of Canadians from fraudulent activities across various Interac products and business. We leverage advanced data analytics and cutting-edge technology to stay ahead of fraud trends. We are looking for a talented Data Insight & Enablement Intern to drive our fraud detection efforts through actionable insights, robust data solutions, and collaborative research.You will be responsible for providing actionable insights into rule-based fraud detection, feature development, and statistical analysis of new and existing fraud trends. You will work under general guidance of Data Specialists or Managers to identify, design, develop and support data solution for business. You will also work with the fraud teams to provide deliverables including research insights, data assets, and visualizations to help the end-user develop a better understanding of the topic.As part of Data & Analytics, this co-op position will assist the enterprise data science and analytics enginnering functions in the development and execution of data products and services. You're great at Mining Data, identify trends, innovative, excellent communicator and quick learnerYou’ll be responsible for: Collaborating with subject matter experts to implement data products (reports, insights, dashboard, etc), document process and identify enhancementAssist in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets -identify trends, patterns, and anomalies within the data to provide meaningful insights. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical solutions. Work with Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or other relevant platforms. Providing recommendations for process improvements based on data analysis and individual research on the latest trends. Documenting processes, methodologies, and insights for future reference. Support in developing and executing programs and initiatives to enhance data literacy and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making. Support in defining key initiatives, milestones, and success metrics for the implementation of the data enablement strategy. Support in developing resources to facilitate continuous learning and development related to data analytics and AI. Identify and implement improvements for existing data products to improve accuracy, usability, and performance. Research and develop new data science tools to improve the countermeasure process, including testing and validation. Conduct ad-hoc data analysis, create reports, and respond to data inquiries with actionable insights using various reporting and data visualization tools. Develop and test Fraud detection rules and conduct fraud trend & alert analysisWorking with internal data and analytics consumers to deliver end-to-end data related projectsContributing to the development of reusable data products and services through operationalization of insights on our cloud data platformBuilding and/or deploying internal tools to solve problems or improve processDeveloping production level code to help productionizing data science research work. Generating new ideas, challenging the status quo, taking risks, supporting change, encouraging innovation, and solving problems creativelyManaging deliverables and timelines for own deliverables, negotiating with internal stakeholders to meet relevant project milestones. You bring: Confidence in your ability to communicate technical/non-technical details, complex data insights and visualizations in an impactful and clear way – you are a storyteller of dataUnderstanding that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making. Experience with manipulating big data using Python, SQL or similar languages for data manipulation or analysisFamiliarity with data mining, data structures, algorithms, machine learning libraries (sklearn, xgboost) and databases such as Redshift and OracleFamiliarity with building and testing machine learning models on cloud platformsExperience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and feature development within relavent industries\The ability to give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You are a proactive problem-solver with a demonstrated track record of driving continuous improvement initiatives – you are a self starter and are able to prioritize tasksCurrently completing an undergraduate degree from a creditable Canadian institution with a focus on business administration (information management, business, management), bachelor of science ( mechanical/electrical engineering) ; data science, data analytic. Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following:Familiarity with Linux-based systems, Git, PySpark, Distributed Computing and software engineering principlesKnowledge of data management, project management and data governance conceptsInterest or understanding of the banking/payments industryFamiliarity with risk or fraud detection contextDedication to research and improve the overall analysis process and ensure data accuracyPrevious internship experience as a data scientist, data analyst or business analystWorkstyle: HybridLocation: TorontoTerm: January to April 2025Working Days: Monday - FridayIMPORTANT - PLEASE NOTE: You must be eligible to work for Interac Corp. in Canada in a Full Time Capacity and to be eligible for Interac internship rolesYou must be currently enrolled in a Canadian post secondary academic institution. Interac requires employees to complete a background check that is completed by one of our service providers. We use this service to complete the following checks:Canadian criminal record check;Public safety verification;Canadian ID cross-check;5-year employment verification;Education verification; andIf applicable, Credit Inquiry and Social Media CheckHow We WorkWe know that exceptional people have great ideas and are passionate about their work. Our culture encourages excellence and actively rewards contributions with:Connection: You’re surrounded by talented people every day who are driven by their passion of a common goal.Core Values: They define us. Living them helps us be the best at what we do.Compensation & Benefits: Pay is driven by individual and corporate performance and we provide a multitude of benefits and perks.Education: To ensure you are the best at what you do we invest in you

The Business Data Analyst will analyze data and prepare detailed reports from company application software. This individual will confer with system users to Our GFL team is expanding, and we’re looking for Data Analyst to join us in Toronto! As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in automating analytics and reporting workflows, collaborating with operations and development teams to produce KPIs based on contract requirements, and using statistical analysis for sensitivity testing, forecasting, and budgeting.Why Join GFL? GFL Environmental is the only major diversified environmental services company in North America. Our employees, collectively known as 'Team Green,' enjoy numerous benefits: career advancement opportunities, competitive benefits, job stability within an essential services company, and the chance to make a positive impact every day for our customers and communities, Green for Life!What’s in it for You:Comprehensive Benefits Plan including prioritized orthodontics and vision careRRSP matching and profit sharingEmployee Assistance Program, life insurance, and more!Paid time offCompetitive wagesGrowth opportunitiesCareer Path Potential:Grow your career! Future Career Path Opportunities may include Senior Data Analysts and more with Team Green!A “Day in the Life" of a Data Analyst: Write complex SQL queries and use Python for data extraction, cleaning, transformation, and statistical analysis. Develop Power BI dashboards to visualize trends and KPIs, linking SQL and Python outputs to Power BI for dynamic updates. Create user-friendly, customized reports by collaborating with stakeholders on reporting needs. Integrate APIs to automate data flows across platforms, documenting processes for API integration as needed. Engage with operations teams to create KPI frameworks, automate reporting, and support data-driven decision-making. Analyze contracts to develop and monitor performance metrics, supporting budgeting through forecasting and reporting. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:2-5 years of progressive experience as a Data Analyst in a similar role with experience working with industry-specific software is a plus. Proficient in SQL (SSMS), Python for data transformation, and Power BI for visualization; experienced in automating data workflows through API integrations. Skilled in applying statistical techniques for data modeling, hypothesis testing, and sensitivity analysis to support data-driven decision-making. Strong interpersonal skills for collaborating with operations teams, gathering requirements, and presenting insights clearly to diverse stakeholders. Familiarity with the recycling industry, EPR programs, or similar operational environments is a strong asset. Join us and become part of "Team Green" at GFL Environmental, where your skills and dedication will be valued and rewarded. Apply now for this exciting opportunity!#GFLTalentWe thank you for your interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Job DescriptionSummary: Seeking a BI Analyst to collaborate with business units in delivering BI solutions and ad hoc analysis that support and track the decisions of the business. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to translate business requirements into actionable dashboards, reports and visualizations. Using tools like SQL, Power BI, Excel, and Python, you’ll provide insights that drive informed decision-making and highlight key trends and opportunities for the business.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Collaborate with business units to gather technical requirements and deliver tailored BI solutions.  Design and develop actionable dashboards, scorecards, reports and data visualizations using Power BI, Excel, Python, and other BI platforms.  Conduct routine and ad hoc analysis to support strategic business decisions.  Build, refine, and optimize datasets in Power BI, incorporating complex DAX calculations and KPIs.  Ensure consistency in business logic and KPI definitions across all BI solutions.  Maintain metadata and custom mappings used in reporting and analysis.  Evaluate existing BI solutions, looking for opportunities to improve them.  Maintain comprehensive data dictionaries, documentation, and source control for all BI processes and solutions.  Work closely with the Data Operations team to develop and document data warehouse collections and datasets needed for BI solutions.  Analyze and understand source system data for validity and completeness, troubleshooting basic data integrity issues and documenting findings.  Implement robust data monitoring practices to maintain high data quality, proactively addressing and resolving any data discrepancies. Qualifications:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Education/Experience: Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science or another analytically focused field (Master’s degree is a strong plus).  3-5 years of experience as a BI analyst or similar analytical role, with a proven track record of supporting strategic business decisions through data analysis and BI solutions.  Advanced proficiency in SQL, with expertise in writing complex and optimized T-SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.  Expertise in Power BI for building impactful dashboards, reports, and visualizations, with proficiency in writing complex DAX calculations.  Extensive experience with Excel for data modeling and analysis, including advanced functions such as Power Query, DAX, XLOOKUP, cube functions, etc.  Proficiency in using Python for data analysis and enhanced visualization. Experience with web scraping or dashboarding capabilities a plus.  Thorough understanding of dimensional data modeling (star schema).  Strong understanding of data governance principles, ensuring consistent business logic & KPI definitions across BI solutions.  Proven ability to identify opportunities to enhance BI solutions, applying strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences. Hill & Knowlton is a strategic and creative partner to drive breakthrough opportunities for growth and value creation, advance corporate strategy, and build reputation capital and resiliency. We’re a proven partner for business and brand transformation. A full-service global firm, we provide strategic communication, marketing and corporate affairs solutions distinguished by intelligence and creativity. Hill & Knowlton is part of the Burson Group and WPP (NYSE: WPP), the creative transformation company. Burson is a full-service global firm that specializes in corporate affairs, distinguished by best in-class data and intelligence capabilities. Burson is a WPP company.Burson is seeking a Research Analyst to join our Data & Intelligence team in Canada. This role presents a unique opportunity to apply and grow your analytical research skills across a range of areas, including statistical programming, quantitative and qualitative research methods, media and social media analysis, data analytics and data visualization.Our work involves the intersection of many people with a wide range of skills within our Data & Intelligence team and across our client teams. Your data management, programming and analytics expertise will be a crucial function within our projects, often acting as a bridge between technical and non-technical team members.There are always interesting projects to work on thanks to Burson’s diverse base of influential clients, including global brands. This role can be based in Ottawa or Toronto and will be a mix of in-office and remote work.Key ResponsibilitiesData analysis: Building and running R scripts to process survey data and media monitoring data that will feed into our client reports / dashboards (Power BI, Displayr, PowerPoint).Data visualization and reporting: Helping to design and maintain our media intelligence and market research reports/dashboards.Operational analytics: Your expertise will also be applied to evaluating the “business of the business” where you will get to work with data from other Burson teams (e.g., finance, operations, people & culture).Technical Experience & SkillsMost of our statistically programming is built in R. Strong preference will be given to candidates with intermediate skill in R. Key responsibilities will be script writing, data cleaning, analysis, tidyverse.We use a variety of platforms for reporting and visualization including Power BI, PowerPoint, and Displayr. Previous experience with these platforms is an asset.Statistics, quantitative data analysis (qualitative data analysis and report writing are assets)Experience communicating statistical concepts (e.g., segmentation analysis, weighting, regression) to non-technical audiences.Two-to-three years of experience in market research or public opinion research or survey research or media intelligence, or a related field. Some of this experience can come from post-secondary programs.Hill & Knowlton is more than an agency. It’s a collection of thousands of brilliant, collaborative and driven employees – all united around a single vision of transforming our clients, our company and the world.Across 70 offices in 30 countries our people are the heartbeat of our business. Bridging countless cultures, backgrounds and lived experiences, we are drawn together by a common drive and a collaborative spirit – called to our craft each day by the desire to deliver the best work.  And at H&K, diversity, equity and inclusion are not just values; they are strategic imperatives that fuel our future in an industry built on the art of understanding, connecting and developing relationships. We believe that a diverse workforce is essential for inspiring bold ideas, fostering constructive dialogue and cultivating meaningful experiences that drive innovation and creativity.When you click the "Submit Application" button below, this will send any information you add below to Burson. What does a Business Insights Analyst do at Swire Coca-Cola?We are seeking a talented and driven Business Insights Analyst to join our Data Apps team. In this role, you will leverage your strong knowledge and experience with SQL Databases and business intelligence reporting tools to develop comprehensive business intelligence reports and conduct ad hoc analysis. You will be responsible for understanding data management policies, procedures, and best practices, and effectively communicating and presenting your findings to key stakeholders. DATA ANALYST APPRENTICE Become a data analyst apprentice. No experience needed. Click "Apply Now" to register & complete our screening.What does a Data Analyst Apprentice do? A data analyst is responsible for collecting, organizing, and examining data to uncover insights that help businesses make informed decisions. They clean and prepare datasets, run queries, and analyze trends using tools like Excel, SQL, R, or data visualization software. Analysts create reports and dashboards to present their findings to stakeholders and collaborate with teams across departments to understand and address their data needs. Their work revolves around transforming raw data into valuable information to guide business strategies and improvements. Success in a data analyst role can lead to a very rewarding career, with clear paths to increase your income and overall professional skill set. How does the program work?During your apprenticeship with Catalyte, you will develop and hone your foundational skills in data analysis under tutelage of our experience team and work on real projects on one of our clients. You will also earn a certification upon completion, which will be essential in growing your future data analysis career.Who can apply?We’re looking for people who have a passion for numbers, analysis, and problem solving, and are eager to jumpstart their career as a data analyst apprentice. As an apprentice at Catalyte, you will be given all the fundamental skills to work for exciting, fast-paced tech companies as a data analyst apprentice.Anyone who meets these three criteria can apply:Be at least 18 years oldBasic proficiency using a computer and the internetBe a U.S. citizen or eligible to work in the U.S. for 30 continuous months from your first day. Catalyte does not offer visa assistance or sponsorship of any kind.Be available to work full-time from approx 9 am-5 pm, Monday-FridayPay and benefitsYou will receive your local minimum wage for 30 hours per week for the first 12 weeks. Starting in week 13, pay will increase to $40,000/year paid hourly ($19.24), and you will receive additional benefits including paid holidays and time-off, health, vision and dental benefits.About CatalyteCatalyte is an AI-enabled workforce company. Its proprietary technology uses 200K data points to discover and develop high-potential talent. As a result, Catalyte offers employers tenacious, high-performing talent that increases productivity, quality and diversity metrics while reducing the total cost of talent. By redefining hiring and elevating ability over resumes, Catalyte transforms individuals, companies and communities. For more information, visitBenefits including Healthcare, Vision, Dental, 401K, and Company Paid Time-Off (including company paid holidays, paid sick leave (6 days), & PTO (6 days)) are available to Catalyte employees. There is no application deadline for this position because Catalyte accepts applications on an ongoing basis. Are you passionate about identifying fraudulent activity and protecting businesses from financial losses? Do you excel at analyzing patterns, developing insights, and creating proactive solutions to prevent fraud? If you're ready to leverage your analytical skills to safeguard our systems, our client has the ideal role for you. We're looking for a Fraud Data Analyst (aka The Fraud Detector) to analyze transaction data, detect potential fraud, and enhance risk mitigation strategies across the organization.As a Fraud Data Analyst at our client, you'll work with fraud prevention teams, data scientists, and risk management to develop models, identify patterns, and implement fraud detection strategies. Your role will be critical in ensuring that potential fraud is detected early and that our client's financial assets and reputation remain protected.Key Responsibilities:Analyze Transaction Data for Fraud Detection:Perform in-depth analyses of transaction data to identify patterns indicative of fraud. You'll use statistical methods to spot anomalies and flag suspicious activities for further investigationDevelop and Maintain Fraud Detection Models:Build predictive models to detect fraudulent behavior in real-time using machine learning and data analytics tools. You'll implement algorithms that help automate fraud detectionCollaborate on Risk Assessment and Prevention Strategies:Work closely with risk management teams to design fraud prevention strategies. You'll provide insights on vulnerabilities and recommend solutions to strengthen fraud defensesConduct Root Cause Analysis on Fraud Incidents:Investigate fraudulent activities to understand their origins and impacts. You'll perform root cause analysis to identify gaps in current controls and suggest improvementsCreate and Maintain Fraud Detection Dashboards:Design and maintain dashboards using tools like Tableau or Power BI to provide real-time monitoring of fraud metrics. You'll ensure that stakeholders have access to actionable insightsImplement Data-Driven Rules and Alerts:Establish data-driven rules and thresholds for flagging suspicious activities. You'll create automated alerts that enable faster responses to potential fraud casesStay Updated on Fraud Trends and Techniques:Keep abreast of the latest trends in fraud schemes, methodologies, and detection technologies. You'll bring innovative strategies to improve fraud prevention and detectionRequirementsRequired Skills: Fraud Analysis and Pattern Recognition: Strong ability to detect patterns, anomalies, and indicators of fraud in data. Familiarity with transaction data analysis and fraud detection techniques Predictive Modeling and Machine Learning: Experience building models for fraud detection using supervised and unsupervised learning techniques. Familiarity with tools like Python, R, or SQL for model development Risk Assessment and Prevention: Understanding of risk management principles and strategies for fraud prevention. Ability to recommend preventive actions based on data insights Data Visualization and Reporting: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker for creating dashboards and presenting fraud data to stakeholders Collaboration and Communication: Excellent communication skills for working with cross-functional teams and explaining complex fraud patterns to non-technical audiencesEducational Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Finance, or a related field. Equivalent experience in fraud analytics or risk management may be consideredCertifications in fraud examination or analytics (e.g., Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE), Certified Analytics Professional) are advantageousExperience Requirements: 3+ years of experience in fraud analysis, risk management, or data analytics, with a proven track record of detecting and preventing fraudulent activitiesFamiliarity with financial services, e-commerce, or insurance fraud detection is highly beneficialExperience with real-time data processing and anomaly detection is a plusBenefitsHealth and Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans with low co-pays and premiumsPaid Time Off: Competitive vacation, sick leave, and 20 paid holidays per yearWork-Life Balance: Flexible work schedules and telecommuting optionsProfessional Development: Opportunities for training, certification reimbursement, and career advancement programsWellness Programs: Access to wellness programs, including gym memberships, health screenings, and mental health resourcesLife and Disability Insurance: Life insurance and short-term/long-term disability coverageEmployee Assistance Program (EAP): Confidential counseling and support services for personal and professional challengesTuition Reimbursement: Financial assistance for continuing education and professional developmentCommunity Engagement: Opportunities to participate in community service and volunteer activitiesRecognition Programs: Employee recognition programs to celebrate achievements and milestones

job_title: Junior Website Analytics Analyst - Google Analytics (Richardson, TX)
requirements: ARGO is a leading provider of software and analytics solutions for both the financial services and healthcare industries. ARGO transforms business processes for financial service providers and healthcare organizations using proven business models and software innovation informed by real customer challenges, breakthrough technology, and rich analytics.Job SummaryAs a Junior Website Analytics Analyst at ARGO, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and optimizing the performance of our digital platforms. With a focus on Google Analytics, you will help us measure website traffic, user behavior, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to drive data-informed decisions across the organization. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with 1-2 years of IT experience, and a passion for website analytics, looking to expand their skill set and make a tangible impact on ARGO’s business strategies.TIME ALLOCATION30%: Google Analytics Management & Reporting – Regular tracking, reporting, and analysis of website performance.25%: Data Tagging & Tracking – Implementing and maintaining tracking tags using Google Tag Manager.20%: Data Analysis & Insights Generation – Identifying trends, actionable insights, and optimization opportunities.15%: Collaboration – Working with cross-functional teams (marketing, IT, product) to support digital initiatives.10%: Professional Development – Learning new skills, staying up to date with the latest analytics trends and tools.OUTCOME / VALUE ADDRoleThe primary outcome of this role is to enable ARGO to make informed, data-driven decisions through precise web analytics. Your contributions will:Provide actionable insights to optimize digital marketing campaigns, website features, and user experience.Ensure accurate tracking of website data, enabling the organization to monitor and improve KPIs effectively.Support the digital strategy with regular reports and recommendations based on user behavior analysis and performance metrics.Product SummaryARGO is a mission-driven software company providing financial services and healthcare customers with cutting-edge technology and analytics. ARGO’s solutions require extensive expertise in both business and technology to support financial products such as Fraud Detection, Teller Payment Systems, Lending, and Omni-channel Delivery, as well as healthcare solutions including Behavioral Health, Utilization Review, Patient Identity Matching/EMR, and Patient Financing.Expected Work And Performance (essential Functions)Google Analytics Reporting & Monitoring:Regularly track and report key metrics including website traffic, engagement, and conversion rates.Build and maintain customized reports and dashboards in Google Analytics to provide visibility into website performance.Analyze trends and identify areas for optimization, providing actionable insights to stakeholders.Data Tagging & Implementation:Support the setup and management of Google Tag Manager for tracking code implementation.Ensure that all relevant interactions (e.g., button clicks, form submissions) are tracked accurately on the website.Troubleshoot and resolve any tagging or tracking issues across digital assets.Data Analysis & Insight Generation:Analyze user behavior and site performance to uncover actionable insights and optimization opportunities.Monitor and report on the effectiveness of ongoing digital campaigns (e.g., traffic sources, user flows).Support A/B testing and experimentation efforts to assess the impact of site changes on key performance indicators.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Work closely with the marketing team to measure the performance of digital marketing campaigns.Collaborate with the product and IT teams to ensure data accuracy and reporting integrity.Participate in meetings with stakeholders to discuss analytics findings and strategy adjustments.Learning & Growth:Stay current with best practices in web analytics and data tracking tools.Pursue professional development opportunities, including certifications (e.g., Google Analytics) and industry knowledge.QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.Experience: 1-2 years of hands-on experience with web analytics, preferably in an IT, marketing, or analytics role.Certification: Google Analytics Individual Qualification (GAIQ) or other relevant certification preferred.Required Skills / Experience / KnowledgeGoogle Analytics Expertise: Experience setting up and analyzing reports in Google Analytics. Ability to monitor and optimize key metrics such as conversion rates, bounce rates, and traffic sources.Tagging & Tracking: Familiarity with Google Tag Manager for implementing and troubleshooting tracking tags.Basic Data Analysis: Ability to analyze website data and generate insights. Knowledge of Excel or Google Sheets for basic data manipulation (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUP).Technical Understanding: Basic knowledge of web technologies such as HTML and JavaScript, and their impact on website tracking.Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills to convey findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.Preferred Skills / Experience / KnowledgeA/B Testing: Experience with A/B testing tools (e.g., Google Optimize, Optimizely) and analyzing experiment results.Website analysis tools: including LookerStudio, and Microsoft ClarityE-commerce Analytics: Experience analyzing e-commerce performance metrics such as transaction data, product views, and conversion funnels.Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Google Data Studio, Tableau, or Power BI to create dynamic reports and dashboards.Advanced Analytics: Exposure to programming languages like Python or SQL for more advanced data analysis.SEO/SEM Knowledge: Understanding of SEO, paid search, and how they intersect with web analytics.ALIGNING TO ARGO VALUE CHAINIn this role, the Google Analytics/SEO candidate will play a crucial part in aligning our product offerings with customer needs throughout the Argo value chain. The ideal candidate will utilize Google Analytics to gather and analyze data on customer interactions, identifying trends and insights that inform product enhancements and marketing strategies. By applying SEO best practices, they will ensure our content is optimized for search engines, increasing visibility and driving targeted traffic. This alignment not only enhances the customer experience but also fosters a deeper connection between our products and the audience, ultimately contributing to sustained growth and customer satisfaction. The candidate will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that both product development and customer engagement strategies are data-driven and aligned with our overall business objectives.ATTENDANCE/WORK LOCATIONThe position is based in our Richardson, TX office. Today, we are reimagining global financial services and building products that extend beyond traditional barriers to give customers access to more of the services they need, no matter where they call home. Join over 2,700 employees worldwide who are growing their careers with purpose and connection with our customers while having a positive impact on millions of people around the globe.About The RoleThe Product Analyst, Fraud will report to the Fraud Program Manager on Remitly’s User Integrity product squad. In this role, you will apply data science and analytics techniques to drive rapid, rational decision-making within one of Remitly’s new products. You'll build our ability to remove fraud risk from our platform through product solutions while streamlining the experience for good customers by partnering with program and product managers, engineers, analysts, and designers.You WillBecome an expert on Remitly's fraud data, product experiences, policies, and systemsBuild a unified understanding of how fraud data, customer experiences, and goals alignDevelop data features and risk rulesBuild and manage metrics used to evaluate fraud system performance and customer friction, and create monitoring measures to track themCreate hypotheses & design product experimentsCreate agent-facing investigative tools to help improve performance and accuracy of our Fraud SpecialistsProduce insights and help define longer term product strategies and roadmapsImplement product strategyYou Have3+ years in a product analyst role or similar full-time, professional experience.Bachelor's degree in mathematics, engineering, economics, or another quantitative field (or equivalent additional experience).Intermediate SQL Proficiency (Python, R, and modeling a bonus).Working knowledge of foundational statistical concepts and how they can be applied in real world situations.Experience distilling business problems, developing hypotheses, building an analytical framework, carrying out an analysis, and writing a clear recommendation.Strong data communication skills, including data visualization, technical writing, and business writing.Compensation Details. The starting base salary range for this position is typically $112,000 -$140,000. In the U.S., Remitly employees are shareholders in our Company and equity is part of our total compensation plan. Your recruiter can share more information about medical benefits offered, as well as other financial benefits and total compensation components offered with this role.Our BenefitsFlexible paid time offHealth, dental, and vision + 401k plan with company matchingPaid parental, medical, military and family care leaveMental Health & Family Forming BenefitsEmployee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)Continuing education and travel benefitsWe are committed to nondiscrimination across our global organization and in all of our business operations. Employment is determined based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identification and expression, marital status, military status or status as an honorably discharge/veteran, pregnancy (including a woman’s potential to get pregnant, pregnancy-related conditions, and childbearing), sexual orientation, age (40 and over), national origin, ancestry, citizenship or immigration status, physical, mental, or sensory disability (including the use of a trained dog guide or service animal), HIV/AIDS or hepatitis C status, genetic information, status as an actual or perceived victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking, or any other protected class as established by law.Remitly is an E-Verify EmployerRemitly is an equal opportunity employer. In today’s rapidly evolving technology landscape, an organization’s data has never been a more important aspect in achieving mission and business goals. Our AI and Data Exploitation experts work with our clients to support their mission and business goals by creating and executing a comprehensive data strategy using the best technology and techniques, given the challenge.At Steampunk, our goal is to build and execute a data strategy for our clients to coordinate data collection and generation, to align the organization and its data assets in support of the mission, and ultimately to realize mission goals with the strongest effectiveness possible.For our clients, data is a strategic asset. They are looking to become a facts-based, data-driven, customer-focused organization. To help realize this goal, they are leveraging visual analytics platforms to analyze, visualize, and share information. At Steampunk you will design and develop solutions to high-impact, complex data problems, working with the best and data practitioners around. Our ai and data exploitation approach is tightly integrated with Human-Centered Design and DevSecOps.We are looking for you to join our team as a Data Analyst. This position focuses on data analysis for law enforcement support, requiring a combination of investigative data expertise, analytical skills, and the ability to work under high-pressure, mission-critical environments. This role will involve working with diverse data sets, ensuring accuracy and integrity while supporting ongoing criminal and civil investigations.Our ideal candidate has a blend of technical acumen, attention to detail, and the ability to engage with law enforcement agencies. We are looking for more than just a "Data Analyst"—this role requires a technologist with excellent communication skills, customer service, and a passion for data and problem-solving.Key ResponsibilitiesData Analysis and Trend Recognition Compile and analyze data from multiple sources, identifying trends across various data sets, locations, and targets.Data Accuracy and Assessment Monitor data for accuracy, integrity, authenticity, and relevancy. Identify intelligence gaps and assess data viability for investigative purposes.Investigative Support Collaborate with teams to examine data gathered from criminal and civil investigations, developing methodologies to exploit investigative information.Quality Control & Reporting Participate in the development of work products, conducting periodic progress reviews and ensuring quality control of findings. Regularly report findings to lead personnel.Data Entry Perform data entry from both hard and soft copies into large-scale data processing systems, utilizing tools like optical character readers, scanners, and digital cameras as appropriate.Law Enforcement Support Provide critical law enforcement support, interacting with various agencies through multiple channels of communication, while managing data under tight timelines in a high-pressure environment.Data Visualization and Tools Leverage MS Excel, Power BI, or similar tools to design and build formulas, charts, pivot tables, and manipulate unstructured data from different platforms.You will be part of our Data Exploitation Practice!RequiredAbility to hold a position of SECRET clearance level with the US government.Bachelor's Degree and 1 year of work experience OR 5 years of work experience and no degree.Experience using data analytic/visualization tools such as MS Excel, Power BI, or others to design charts, create formulas, and analyze unstructured data (can be job or education-based).Skilled at multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment while maintaining clear communications with stakeholders.Must be local to El, Paso TX or willing to drive on site 5 days a week.PreferredExperience providing support to a 24/7 law enforcement operations unit. Military or law enforcement background or exposure.Ability to manage multiple tasks in a high-paced environment, including collaboration with various teams.Strong analytical skills for identifying trends, gaps, and ensuring data accuracy and Experience with documenting processes and developing SOPs for data handling and Demonstrated experience in reverse engineering and validation of data processes.Ability to communicate findings and updates effectively during briefings and team Steampunk relies on several factors to determine salary, including but not limited to geographic location, contractual requirements, education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience. The projected compensation range for this position is $35,000 to $50,000. The estimate displayed represents a typical annual salary range for this position. Annual salary is just one aspect of Steampunk’s total compensation package for employees. Learn more about additional Steampunk benefits here.Steampunk is a Change Agent in the Federal contracting industry, bringing new thinking to clients in the Homeland, Federal Civilian, Health and DoD sectors. Through our Human-Centered delivery methodology, we are fundamentally changing the expectations our Federal clients have for true shared accountability in solving their toughest mission challenges. As an employee owned company, we focus on investing in our employees to enable them to do the greatest work of their careers – and rewarding them for outstanding contributions to our growth. If you want to learn more about our story, visit http//www.steampunk.com.We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Established in 1976 the Saskatchewan Indian Institute of Technologies (SIIT) is a First Nation governed post-secondary institution. Recognized under provincial legislation, the Institute has been conferred authority to grant certificates and diplomas. SIIT welcomes over 2400 students into our urban and community programs annually as well as serving over 6000 clients through our nine Career Centres across the province. The Saskatchewan Indian Institute of Technologies is playing a significant role in Saskatchewan's economic future. This position involves analyzing, interpreting, and reporting on data related to student enrollment, retention, academic performance, institutional effectiveness, and other areas. About VouchInsurance... sounds slow, old-fashioned, and unexciting. Exactly. Insurance is broken, and it's failing fast-moving, innovative startups.Vouch is a new, technology-first insurance company backed with $185M in funding from world-class investors. Like Stripe for payments or Brex for credit cards, Vouch is creating the go-to business insurance for high-growth companies.We're doing this by making insurance fast, responsive, and focused on our high-growth and innovative customers. Instead of printed PDF applications and week-long waits, Vouch is building new technology to solve real problems, writing policies that actually cover relevant startup scenarios, and designing simple experiences in an otherwise frustrating industry.Why should you join our team and Vouch?Not only is this an exciting and growing team where you can drive a real impact on our operational scalability, but Vouch is also the preferred insurance provider to customers of Y Combinator, Brex, Carta, and WeWork. We’re a quickly growing startup that believes in transparency and acknowledgment with our team members and cultivating a values-driven company. Our values are “Put People First,” “Listen, Challenge, and Grow,” “Face challenges head-on and win as a team,” and “Serve clients with integrity and excellence.”What does a work environment look like at Vouch?Vouch has employees located across the U.S., with offices in San Francisco, Chicago, and New York City. This role can be based anywhere in the U.S. as long as you can work our Vouch core collaboration hours (8:30 am-2:30 pm Pacific Time) when most internal meetings are held.Role ResponsibilitiesAs an insurance company, data is at the core of everything we do at Vouch. Data and analysis are critical to improving our clients' insurance design, underwriting, and outcomes. Data also drives our business operations and our financial decisions. As a Senior Data Analyst at Vouch, you’ll have the unique opportunity to build the foundational data structure, tools, and models to help all of our functions become increasingly data-driven. You will be part of the Analytics team and sit cross-functionally, working closely with the data team, finance, biz ops, and product managers who work across all of our functions.You will work with our teams + stakeholders to build and maintain foundational data sets, dashboards, and analytical frameworks to address challenges and questions for a specific business unit within our organization. Additionally, you will take ownership of the data asset development process from discovery to post-launch, driving key decisions that impact the data domain.Job DutiesDevelop an advanced understanding data sets to identify performance drivers and opportunities to optimize the businessLead data projects end-to-end from discovery to activation and post-launch in collaboration with a cross-functional team of Engineering, Product, GTM, etc.Clearly document data models with source, description, and field definitions to enhance collaboration, scalability, and usabilityTie goals back to business metrics such as written premium, conversion rates, or top-of-funnel growthAbout You3-6 years of experience working as a data analyst, data scientist, consultant, or equivalent quantitative analytical analytics Guide business decisions related to market segment strategy, marketing spend, pricing, product roadmap, and sales programs Synthesize and present large amounts of information in a stakeholder-management skills including requirement gathering, establishing vision, managing expectations, collecting feedback, continuous improvement, and consistent communication Attention to detail and data accuracy.
